body.p: DPATH is introduced in this context as a means of addressing elements in a document with a flat structure. It has some resemblance with xpath, but is much simpler and has less precision.
The basic structure in an DPATH-expression is best considered as an analogy to a unix filepath.

tr.td: Will select all material under heading-level 3 with name Results
Will attempt to select all material under headings level 1
Will select all material under heading-level 3 with name Results which are under header-level 2 with name Semifinal

body.p: We may also have a spesification part, or selection part, in the form []. The purpose is to filter the elements we use.

ul.li: [*] will have no filtering effect, all elements will be included.
[p,img] wil select only elements of type p and img.

tr.td: Will select all material under heading-level 3 with name Results
Will select all elements of type table under heading-level 3 with name Results
